profileText: A Representative from Vermont; born in Canterbury, Windham County, Conn., December 24, 1772; was graduated from Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., in 1795; studied medicine and practiced in Putney, Vt.; member of the State house of representatives; elected as a Federalist to the Fourteenth Congress (March 4, 1815-March 3, 1817); moved to St. Johnsbury, Caledonia County, Vt.; studied theology; was ordained as a minister and officiated in Newbury, Vt., 1821-1828; returned to St. Johnsbury and published the Farmer's Herald 1828-1832 and the Free Mason's Friend 1830-1832; died in St. Johnsbury, Vt., March 8, 1860; interment in Mount Pleasant Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Parker and Jewett family letters, 1816-1835, 9 items.
researchRecord.description: The first letter, written to Hannah Parker by Dr. Luther Jewett, is dated November 19, 1816 and contains family information and religious sentiments.

researchRecord.name: In the Massachusetts historical documents collection, 1650-1943, 2 linear feet.
